Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back on fairy tales, thanks to alot of aesthetic work mostly done by music and beautiful sets or characters design.
That aside, one character design whose story is so different from the general flow bothered me while watching with its background details.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy flocked to the moon years before. Some were not enough secure up there, however, and decided that it would be better on one of the moons that might orbit an 'uninhabited' gas giant? Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless action film. In Canada stopping for gasoline, Joe fends off an attack by the has just targeted him for death due to an incomplete mission and vows to get what is rightfully his.
